Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Ryder System, Inc. (NYSE: R) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of November 1, 2024, sourced from Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):
- **Latest Closing Price**: $135.21
- **Market Capitalization**: $5.82 billion
- **52-Week Range**: $98.26 - $143.75
- **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: 12.35
- **Dividend Yield**: 1.84% (quarterly dividend of $0.81/share declared Oct 24, 2024)

## Company Overview (198 words)
Ryder System, Inc. is a leading provider of transportation and logistics solutions, specializing in fleet management, dedicated transportation, and supply chain services. Founded in 1934 and headquartered in Miami, FL, Ryder operates a fleet of over 256,000 vehicles (as per Q2 2024 10-Q filing) across the U.S., Canada, and Europe. The company serves a diverse customer base, including Fortune 500 firms in retail, food & beverage, manufacturing, and e-commerce sectors.

Ryder's business is divided into three segments:
- **Fleet Management Solutions (FMS)**: ~78% of 2023 revenues; full-service truck leasing, commercial rental, and maintenance.
- **Dedicated Transportation Solutions (DTS)**: ~13%; manages dedicated fleets with drivers for clients.
- **Supply Chain Solutions (SCS)**: ~9%; end-to-end logistics, including warehousing, transportation management, and e-commerce fulfillment.

With 2023 total revenues of $11.77 billion (down 1.9% YoY per 2023 10-K), Ryder emphasizes asset-light growth in DTS/SCS while leveraging its owned fleet for stable FMS cash flows. The company focuses on technology integration (e.g., AI-driven route optimization) and sustainability, targeting 50% emissions reduction by 2030.

## Recent Developments
- **Q3 2024 Earnings (Reported Oct 24, 2024)**: Total revenues $3.12 billion (flat YoY); Operating revenues $2.96 billion (+1.3% YoY); Diluted EPS $3.16 (vs. $3.04 expected, +7.2% beat per Earnings Whisper). FMS EBT $257.3 million (+2%); DTS EBT $35.4 million (+28%); SCS EBT $17.2 million (-22%). Full-year 2024 guidance raised: EPS $12.75-$13.25 (from $12.50-$13.00).
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Jul 25, 2024)**: Revenues $3.02 billion (-8.3% YoY); EPS $3.70 (+23% YoY beat).
- **Dividend Increase (Oct 24, 2024)**: Raised to $0.81/share from $0.75, payable Dec 13, 2024.
- **Fleet Expansion**: Added 13,000 vehicles to FMS fleet in 2024 YTD (per Q3 call).
- **Stock Repurchase**: $200 million authorized in Q3; 1.2 million shares repurchased YTD.

## Growth Strategy
- **DTS/SCS Expansion**: Target 10-15% annual growth via acquisitions and organic wins; post-Cardinal integration, DTS now ~$1.8B run-rate.
- **Asset-Light Shift**: Grow DTS/SCS to 30% of EBITDA by 2026 (from 20% in 2023, per Q3 call).
- **Technology Investments**: $100M+ annually in AI telematics, predictive maintenance (RyderShare platform), and EV pilots (50 Class 8 EVs deployed Sep 2024).
- **Used Vehicle Sales Optimization**: Leverage $2.5B+ auction sales backlog despite soft market.

## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | High interest rates (8-9% capex cost) pressuring FMS margins (Q3 FMS gross margin 18.9%); Weak used truck residuals (-20% YoY). | Strong contract leasing renewals (95% retention); DTS wins $400M+ TCV in Q3. |
| **Sector**  | Freight recession (Cass Index -5% YoY); Labor shortages in trucking.     | E-commerce surge (+12% volumes per SCS); Nearshoring boosting dedicated fleets. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **FMS**: Full-service lease (80% fleet), contract maintenance, rental (50,000+ vehicles).
- **DTS**: 10,000+ tractors, 25,000 trailers; driver-managed fleets.
- **SCS**: 40M sq ft warehousing; TMS software for 50,000+ daily shipments.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **RyderShare 2.0** (launched Q2 2024): AI load-matching platform; early pilots with 15 clients.
- **EV Fleet Initiative** (announced Jun 2024): 500 EV leases by 2025 with Freightliner, Lion Electric partnerships.
- **Cardinal Integration** (post-$1.5B acquisition Apr 2023): New last-mile dedicated services rolled out Q1 2024.

## Market Share Approximations and Forecast
- **Truck Leasing**: ~12% U.S. market share (FMS fleet ~8% of 3.2M Class 8 trucks; per ACT Research Q3 2024).
- **Dedicated Contract Carriage**: ~5-7% (post-Cardinal; Transport Topics 2024 ranking #6).
- **3PL Logistics**: ~2% warehousing (SCS; Armstrong 2024 report).
- **Forecast**: FMS stable at 11-13% (mature market); DTS +2-3ppt to 8-10% by 2026 (acquisitions); SCS +1ppt to 3% via e-comm. Overall share growth +1.5% CAGR, driven by DTS (per Q3 guidance).

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric (2023/TTM)          | Ryder (R)      | Penske (PAG FMS) | Enterprise FM | XPO (Logistics) |
|----------------------------|----------------|------------------|---------------|-----------------|
| **Rev ($B)**              | 11.77         | ~30 (FMS only)  | 35           | 7.8            |
| **EBITDA Margin**         | 22.1%         | 25%             | 18%          | 20%            |
| **Fleet Size (k vehicles)**| 256           | 450             | 500          | N/A (asset-light)|
| **Market Cap ($B)**       | 5.82          | 25              | Private      | 13.2           |
| **EV/ EBITDA Multiple**   | 7.2x          | 9x              | N/A          | 10x            |
| **Key Edge**              | DTS growth    | Scale            | Rental focus | Tech/asset-light|

Ryder trades at discount to peers on EV/EBITDA (sector avg 9x), reflecting cyclical FMS exposure.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: OEMs (GM, Ford for upfits; Oct 2024); Tech (Geotab telematics, Manhattan Associates TMS).
- **M&A**: Cardinal Logistics ($1.5B, Apr 2023); G&D Integrated ($100M, 2022). No major 2024 deals; $500M dry powder.
- **Major Clients**: PepsiCo (long-term FMS), IKEA (SCS fulfillment), Whirlpool (DTS); 35% rev from top 10 clients (2023 10-K). Potential: Amazon, Walmart expansions (Q3 call teases $200M pipeline).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: CDP A- score; 25% fleet alternative fuel (Q3 2024).
- **Management**: CEO Robert E. Sanchez (since 2013); strong capital allocation (ROIC 12%).
- **Online Sentiment**: Positive on Seeking Alpha/Reddit (r/stocks, r/investing; Oct 2024 threads praise dividend hike, DTS momentum); short interest 2.1% (low).
- **Risks**: Debt/EBITDA 3.2x (manageable); cyclicality tied to industrial production.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **8/10 (Strong Buy)** â€“ Attractive valuation (12x forward P/E vs. sector 15x), DTS tailwinds, earnings beats, and dividend growth outweigh FMS headwinds. Strong growth upside (15-20% EPS CAGR to 2026) suits moderate risk; limited downside via asset base.
- **Fair Value Estimate**: $165 (22% upside). DCF-based (10% WACC, 3% terminal growth) using Q3 guidance; aligns with 9x 2025 EV/EBITDA peer avg. Hold above $150; add on dips to $120.
